about_me:
My name is Berkay Ceylan, and I am a elementary science teacher. I have a passion for creating innovative projects that make a difference in people's lives. My love for technology and teaching led me to pursue a career in software development, and I am proud of the work that I have accomplished so far.

				I have completed several projects throughout my career that have helped me to hone my skills and gain valuable experience in the field. One of my most notable projects is a robotic hand that I created to teach students about servo motors, Bluetooth modules, and IR modules. This project was a great way for me to combine my love of robotics with my passion for education.

				In addition to the robotic hand, I have also developed a 3D biodiversity model to teach students about the importance of biodiversity. I created a video that features 3D models of various plants and animals to make the learning experience more engaging and interactive.

				Another project that I am particularly proud of is an augmented reality application that allows users to view 3D models and videos by holding their phones up to images. This project was a great way for me to explore the potential of AR technology and its applications in education.

				As a teacher, I have completed several projects in various programming languages and frameworks.

				Apart from these projects, I have also developed a music player using ElectronJS, a pure website using PHP, MySQL, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and jQuery, and several other software applications.

				Recently, I've also created two new apps in Flutter. The first one is a Periodic Table app that features an interactive periodic table of elements with detailed information on each element, including their atomic number, symbol, name, electron configuration, and summary. The app also includes a 3D Bohr model for each element, making it a great resource for students studying chemistry.

				The second app I've created is a 15 Puzzle game that features random shuffling of tiles at the beginning of the game, a move counter to keep track of the number of moves the player makes, and a timer to track the time it takes to solve the puzzle. The tiles are color-coded to show which ones are in the correct position and the tile and text styles are customizable.

				Overall, I am passionate about using technology to make a difference in people's lives, whether it is through education, entertainment, or productivity. I am constantly striving to improve my skills and knowledge in the field, and I look forward to taking on new challenges and creating even more innovative projects in the future.

projects.name: time_bar_flutter
projects.title: Time Bar Flutter Package
projects.detail: I've created a video for teach "How to create time bar?" in Flutter and "How can we publish our codes on pub.dev?" The TimeBar Flutter package is an innovative time management tool. The package provides a customizable time bar widget that can be integrated into any Flutter app to help users track time more effectively. The time bar widget is highly customizable, allowing developers to adjust the look and functionality to suit their specific needs. The package includes various features, such as customizable time intervals, customizable colors and animations, and an interactive progress bar. The package is open source and available on GitHub, making it accessible to developers worldwide. The TimeBar Flutter package is an excellent example of how developers can leverage the power of Flutter to create innovative and useful tools for a wide range of applications.

projects.name: evapp_flutter
projects.title: Evapp Flutter
projects.detail: As a teacher, I have worked on a variety of projects that showcase my skills and expertise in different programming languages and technologies. One project that I am particularly proud of is a collaboration with a customer to create a program that can detect sign language and translate it into spoken words. The project consists of two programs: a Python program that uses AI to detect sign language from a live camera feed, and a Flutter program that can transfer the phone camera to a website as a live stream, receive the words detected by the Python program, and send them to a Bluetooth device for text-to-speech conversion. This innovative application has the potential to revolutionize communication for people with hearing impairments by providing a real-time, accurate translation of sign language. I am proud of my contribution to this project, which demonstrates my proficiency in both Python and Flutter, as well as my ability to work collaboratively with clients to achieve their goals.

projects.name: robotic_hand
projects.title: Robotic Hand
projects.detail: I developed 5 years ago a robotic hand using Arduino C and AppInventor, which can be controlled through a phone application using a HTC-06 Bluetooth module. The hand is equipped with servo motors that can be controlled with precision via a slider in the phone app, as well as through tilting the phone. The hand can also be controlled remotely using an IR module on the Arduino. Additionally, I utilized a 3D printer to create the hand, demonstrating my ability to work with advanced technology. This project showcases my technical proficiency in programming, as well as my creativity and passion for developing innovative solutions.

projects.name: digital_puzzle
projects.title: Digital Puzzle
projects.detail:
As an educator, I am constantly seeking innovative ways to make learning fun and engaging for my students. One project that I am particularly proud of is my digital puzzle, which combines the use of Arduino, RFID cards, and visual stimuli to teach various subjects.

The digital puzzle consists of a set of puzzle pieces, each with a unique RFID tag attached to it. These puzzle pieces correspond to different words and images related to the subject being taught. When a student correctly matches a puzzle piece with its corresponding image or word, a light turns on, indicating that the answer is correct.

The project is highly customizable, allowing me to easily change the images and words to suit the specific subject being taught. Moreover, the feedback from students has been overwhelmingly positive, with many remarking on how much more engaging and fun it is to learn using this method.

Overall, the digital puzzle demonstrates my commitment to innovative teaching methods and my ability to leverage technology to enhance the learning experience.
